title: Cosmetic Dish in the Form of a Fish
description:
Slate toilet dish in the form of a fish; eyes inlaid with shell and dark paste. Separate lid attached by pivot at tail. Detail of fins and gills incised.
Condition: Inlay missing from one eye.
medium: Graywacke, inlay of shell and black paste

completeness.name: Best
completeness.description: All data has been vetted. Objects generally have quality photos and descriptions.

labels.title: 37.629E
labels.content: A container for cosmetics or possibly medical ointment, this covered dish represents a tilapia fish. The tilapia symbolized fertility and was believed to promote abundance on earth and a renewed life after death. This container’s lid swivels open at the tail.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art
